text: hi everyone today recipe is more

ways ball by mom it can be a great

so let's begin

I have here 500 gram minks beef and 100
gram means pork we want the meat to have
some fat in it so that when we grill it
for me to cry we're gonna season the
beef and marinate it with one tablespoon
minced garlic a tablespoon of minced
shallot three tablespoon of minced
lemongrass it's actually better to mix
the white part of fresh lemongrass but
I'm just too lazy to do that so I just
bought this package of frozen wings
lemongrass at the Asian store we also
want to season the beef with salt sugar
and chicken stock about a teaspoon each
and also a tablespoon of soy sauce or
sauce this is optional you can add in a
teaspoon of five-spice powder for hint
of spice and three tablespoon of crushed
peanuts to make the texture more complex
[Music]
give it a really good mix and set aside
for about 15 minutes or cover and leave
it a few hours in the fridge Vito is a
very popular plants in savage Asia in
some countries like in Singapore you can
see it everywhere in the park but I
think only the Vietnamese use it for
cooking so what you do is detach the
Batali's from their stems rings each
lift gently and pat dry with kitchen
Tower be careful not to tear the leaf
because it's going to be difficult to
roll later so we're gonna need about 30
to 35 leaves for this recipe to replace
the leaf on a flat surface with the
darker side facing down and the stem
pointing out
scoop one tablespoon foon of the meat
and shape nicely near to the tip of the
leaf then roll it and when you nearly
reach the stem you are toothpick or a
skewer to punch a hole in the middle and
then insert the stem into the leader
hole to secure these Batali's can be
bought frozen or fresh at the Asian
store the method of making this dish
varies from region to region in Vietnam
in some other part people use a sliced
beef and not mixed and maybe roll it
like this so actually there's no right
or wrong way to roll you just do
whatever way that you are comfortable
with you can just leave it like that or
insert them into a skewer if you're
going to bring this to a BBQ party in
the park
not only your friends are getting crazy
but also the people in the park because
it's gonna smell so amazing when you
grill them but even though grilling on
charcoal is a better option we don't
always have the luxury to grill outdoor
so you can also grill it in the oven
remember to brush vegetable oil all over
the pita roll before and during the
grilling this is to avoid the bitter
leaf from getting burnt and the meat
from getting too dry
you can grill at about 180 degrees SS or
375 iron Heights for about 15 to 20

place it into the pan make sure you
place the secure part the outputs you
can fry for about two-and-a-half to
three minutes each side on medium heat
if you have to pan fry them like this
make sure that you kept the leaves

the water then a splash like hell when

mmm smells so good so this is our final

so this is how we serve bolo
you need a platter of fresh vegetables

seconds top up with fresh vegetables
cucumber rice vermicelli and a piece of

and then dip into the anchovy fish sauce
so everyone on the table has to roll
